reviews.sentence: Decent hotel just needs finishing touches. The staff was very friendly and location was good. Restaurants and shopping were nearby. The amenities were nice. The carpet did not go all the way to the walls and they put a couch in front of the balcony door. Instead of having an outlet near the bed they daisy chained extension cords for the bed lights. There was only a single hook in the bathroom for hanging a toiletry bag or towel. The room was clean just do n’t open the curtains or look in the shower. The sliding glass door was filthy. The shower was stained badly and the water did not drain properly. Had 2 inches of dirty water after 10 minutes. HD channels work if your room is close to the front desk. Rooms at the far end of the building have poor signal and continually receive no signal. Standard TV channels were fine. Only 2 ice machines one on the first floor and the other on the sixth. No refrigerators or microwaves in room. Only one way to get to any floor from the basement which is where a majority of the parking is. Just 1 bank of 2 elevators located on the far end of the hotel from the only basement entrance. Most of the parking is near the basement entrance of the hotel with few spaces by the main entrance. No stairs were stairs available from the basement to the other floors by the basement entry only emergency fire escape stairs in the basement. All in all not horrible but for the price and the Sheraton name I would have expected better.
Ballgame. Nice hotel with great helpful staff. One can walk to the ball park from the hotel and save the parking fee. Clean Very convenient to see a ballgame in KC. Nothing.

Good value. Staff was courteous and helpful. Kaufman Stadium and Arrowhead is just an 8 minute walk across the street. Rooms clean and beds were very comfortable. Room upgraded at no cost. Short staff at check in time.

Nice hotel. Nice beds friendly staff clean hotel. The only problem we had was the ice machine was not working on the floor we were on and the water did not drain well from the bath tub. Most of it was very good particularly for the price. Deneys Ice machines needed to be fixed and the drain needed to be fixed so that it drained better.

Great Staff. The staff at the door was fantastic and very helpful and hospitable. Tre Q went out of his way to help us call around to find a pizza place that would deliver after 11 pm since we had no idea where the pizza places were close by. He was also helping a couple others that were also needing help finding food. We were very grateful for the help after calling several pizza places that were out of the immediate area without knowing. Also the room was clean and very nice. 5 stars for this hotel.

perfect place for Chiefs Royals game. we stayed here mostly because it was close to arrowhead and we were planning on tailgating before the game. Knowing we did not want a long drive sunday morning we booked at the four points. the hotel was very clean and offers balconies in the rooms which was great for my friends that smoke. Staff was really friendly and they have a nice bar if you are looking for a place to catch a drink.
Stay here if you must. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Greeted and smiled alot. My bed was very comfy and I had a great view of the stadium. Bathroom looked like it was not cleaned properly.

Horrible. The daytime staff was very kind and helpful however we dealt with two very rude night shift ladies. The heavy set red haired night shift lady was the worst. She has no business in this industry. Would have been great if the staff was trained better.

Property is a bit worn. The front desk staff members were all energetic and helpful. that is the good news. The bad news is this property is looking tired. I am sure it is a great location if you are attending a sports event across the street but business folk who travel a lot will want to look elsewhere. I had to change rooms because the AC was so loud I could not talk and the bathroom was being repaired without knowledge of the front desk.

Even though our door lock broke during our stay which was an inconvenience the staff made it up to us and was over the top apologetic. Staff was AWESOME all wekSlight smell when you come off the elevators going to the pool. Other than that it was great.

My Husband and his competitive softball team checked in just this evening. I called early this afternoon to verify confirm the reservation as I knew they would be arriving after 10 pm According to the staff everything was set. Not only did they not get the rooms that we booked but there were no linens on the beds. I was lied to my husband was lied to and the staff was rude. Utterly ridiculous.

Horrible. The power went out around 9 pm on Saturday night and never came back on. Our stay was miserable at best. I do not think we will ever use this service again. We were unable to change our reservations. Not good at all. Everything and we were not offered anything for being inconvenienced.

Great staff. Our stay was nice. A few problems in the room but we did not complain because they were minor. Loose faucet light blew fuse and did not work rest of stay. But I was most impressed with the staff who found my daughters items she had left behind. We got home and realized we left the dresser drawer full of her things. The manager has them and is mailing them to us. We were sick to our stomach until we talked to the staff and found out they were sending them. Love the honesty. Thank you.

Close to stadiums. It was an okay greeting at the desk. However we were not provided much info about the hotel and times of anything. We were given vague directions to our room. The room does not have information booklets about the hotel local eateries etc. And the bed is hard as a rock with extremely soft pillows.
They did not have a room ready for us even after we arrived at 530pm but the staff was great and comped us breakfast and had us a fresh room in less than 15 minutes. Great people working here.
The service was good but the rooms needed some work. We had a patio but the door did not work on it.

High Crime Area. We met friends at the hotel who had both of their catalytic converters stolen from under their vehicle the one night we stayed. The camera pointing directly at the vehicle apparently was not recording and was for observation only. According to the staff no one was observing. Save your money and stay in a better part of Kansas City.

Outside Plain and Boxy Inside Nice Lobby Boring Hallways Dirty Rooms Food Not Included. But enjoy our 12 breakfast buffet Service Nonexistent Price. You pay for WAY MORE than you get. do not stay here. This hotel has problems and you way overpay. The rooms are not properly cleaned. The front desk help does not even attempt to make an effort to care about your issues. When you complain you are screaming into the void. Management does not answer their emails. Found a dirty balled up towel in our room. Shower did not work properly. Front desk does not care when you have problems. Management does not answer their emails. Avoid.
Disappointing at best. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. The staff was rude and slow. Long lines.

Good. FIRST ISUEI booked 2 rooms for 2 nights prior to the game on Sunday. This hotel sells the point that you will be with in walking distance to stadium. Saturday afternoon they posted a notice that unles you were staying Sunday night your vehicle would be towed. I would not have booked this hotel had I known this prior. I had to pay for stadium parking which by Saturday night was no where near the stadium. Again if I had this information prior I would have not booked this hotel and would have been able to purchase closer parking at the stadium. SECOND ISUEI called Friday during the day to let the staff know that one of people in my party 2 rooms booked would be checking in at regular check in time. I however was traveling from Colorado and would not be able to check in till after 3 or 4 Saturday morning. I wanted to check in at that time and go to sleep and not have to wait around until 3 pm Saturday for regular check in. I knew I was paying for Friday night I do this for the convenience of checking in at 5 am. I was assured there would be no problem. When I arrived at 5 am I was informed that they almost canceled my reservation. I was told the hotel already charged my card for the room. I had no issue with this. Then the associate at the desk told me they needed to run my card again. It came back declined. I contacted my bank and they confirmed my bank had put a hold on my card due to three different charges made from this hotel in a short period of time that morning around 2 am. This was not at all a pleasant check in. I felt my business was an inconvenience.
Pool was broken. Our toilet got plugged up and was not taken care of when the staff came to clean the rooms.

The hotel is run down and outdated. Is under construction and the pool is closed. Not told this at booking. everything in the room needs to be refurbished. our mattress was ripped. No drink or food service till the pub opens a five pm.
Disgusting balcony doors locked from outside and rude staff. Run down building and parking lot. Cancelled as soon as we pulled up.

This place needs some serious help. As we check in we see notice they are remodeling so pool is closed. Would be nice if this was on their website. Get to room TV does not work but they did fix promptly. The room has no bedside lamps or headboard. So it is dark pillows keep slipping behind mattress. Also ice machine on our floor is broken so have to go to next floor for ice. Next morning we have some walk into our room. Ask at front desk the guy who helped us the night before just gave us keys but never checked us in. Come back to room after outing keys do not work. Staff do not smile are not friendly at all. Spoke to you like you were homies instead of paying customers. No apologies for yet another screw up. Building is dirty. There were nasty hand prints food on floor in elevators for 3 days we were there.

Worst check in I have ever experienced in my 35 years of traveling. Over an hour. Arrived at 345PM. Finally got in a room at 45PM. Manager conveniently went home for day. The two ladies at the desk were in a no win situation. Felt bad for them to a point. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Good. Close to the Royals Stadium. Television and Room telephone were not working and could not be fixed. Someone from the staff entered our room while we were at the game but no one bothered to tell us. I knew someone had been in the room. I called the front desk about the telephone and television and the fact that someone had been in our room. The front desk made a lot of excuses but I insisted they do something about it the front desk said they would comp the room. Non other available. However when we checked out the front desk knew nothing about it. I told the front desk person what I was promised and they did comp the room but if I would not have complained they would n’t have done a thing about it. I hope we do n’t have to use this place again.
